Comparison of average premiums before an: ACA): The expert's verdict mentions that a study was conducted to calculate the average premiums in 2013 and 2014, before and after the individual mandate of the ACA took effect. This comparison helped verify the claim about the increase in premiums.
Addition of average rate increases from: To further validate the claim, the expert extended the study by adding the average rate increases in Wisconsin for 2015, 2016, and 2017. These rate increases were calculated by the Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance.
Methodology used to calculate premium in: PolitiFact Wisconsin used a methodology similar to the one employed in the study mentioned above. They averaged the five lowest-cost plans available in each Wisconsin county from 2015 to 2017, which yielded similar results to the claim made by Senator Ron Johnson.
Confirmation from the state insurance of: The state insurance office spokesperson, Elizabeth Hizmi, supported the claim by stating that rates increased in the first year and, for some, more than doubled. This confirmation from a reliable source adds to the authenticity of the claim.
